View Javadoc
1   package de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.strategies.eclipse.xml;
2   
3   import java.io.File;
4   import java.io.IOException;
5   import java.util.ArrayList;
6   import java.util.List;
7   import javax.validation.constraints.NotNull;
8   
9   import org.apache.commons.digester3.Digester;
10  
11  import org.xml.sax.SAXException;
12  
13  /**
14   * This class reads a config file for Eclipse code formatter.
15   *
16   * @author jecki
17   * @author Matt Blanchette
18   */
19  public class ConfigReader {
20  	/**
21  	 * Read from the given {@link File} and return it's configuration settings as a
22  	 * {@link List}.
23  	 *
24  	 * @param normalizedFile the {@link File} to read
25  	 *
26  	 * @return return {@link List} with all the configurations read from the config file,
27  	 *         or throws an exception if there's a problem reading the input, e.g.: invalid XML.
28  	 *
29  	 * @throws SAXException        if there are parsing issues
30  	 * @throws IOException         if there is a I/O issue
31  	 * @throws ConfigReadException if the given file is not a eclipse formatter template
32  	 */
33  	@NotNull
34  	public List<Profile> read(File normalizedFile) throws IOException, SAXException, ConfigReadException {
35  		if (normalizedFile == null) {
36  			return new ArrayList<>();
37  		}
38  
39  		Digester digester = new Digester();
40  		digester.addRuleSet(new RuleSet());
41  
42  		Object result = digester.parse(normalizedFile);
43  		if (result == null || !(result instanceof Profiles)) {
44  			throw new ConfigReadException("No profiles found in config file");
45  		}
46  
47  		Profiles profiles = (Profiles) result;
48  
49  		return profiles.getProfiles();
50  	}
51  }
